tit.cmt: 鞍馬山鋼索鉄道→Mount Kurama's Funicular Railway [定訳不明]

sen.j: 鞍馬山鋼索鉄道（くらまやまこうさくてつどう）は、京都府京都市左京区にある洛北の名刹、宗教法人鞍馬寺が参詣者の利便を図って運行しているケーブルカー。
sen.e: Mount Kurama's Funicular Railway is a funicular operated for its visitors' convenience by Kurama-dera Temple, which is a religious corporation and a famous temple located in Rakuhoku, or Sakyo-ku, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

The Mount Kurama Cable Railway is a funicular line operated for the convenience of visitors to the area by Kurama-dera Temple, which is a religious corporation and a famous temple located in the Rakuhoku area of Sakyo-ku, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: According to the Japanese at least, I think Rakuhoku is located in Sakyo-ku, isn't it? As opposed to Rakuhoku and Sakyo-ku being different names for the same area, which the translation seems to suggest.
sen.e: The Mount Kurama Cable Railway is a funicular line operated for the convenience of visitors to the area by Kurama-dera Temple, which is a religious corporation and a famous temple located in the Rakuhoku area of Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 鉄道事業法による許可を受けた鉄道としては唯一の、宗教法人が運営しているケーブルカーであり、日本一短い鉄道である。
sen.e: Among all railways permitted by Railway Business Act, this is the only one which is operated by a religious corporation, and the shortest in the distance.

Of all the railways that have been granted permission to operate under the Railway Business Act, it is the only one that is operated by a religious corporation, and it is also the shortest in distance.

Of all the railways that have been granted permission to operate under the Railway Business Act, it is the only one that is operated by a religious corporation, and it is also the shortest in distance.

sen.j: 単線で行き違い設備はない。
sen.e: It has a single track and has no facilities for two-way transportation.
As it has only a single track, it is not equipped for two-way transportation.
As it has only a single track, it is not equipped for two-way transportation.

sen.j: 乗務員や「出札」係員などの多くは作務衣を着用している。
sen.e: Many of the employees, including the crew and the 'ticket agent,' wear their samues, the kimono-style shirt and pants, originally used as work clothes for Zen monks.
Many of the railway's employees, including the crew and the ticket agents, wear samue (work clothes worn by Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: I realize quotation marks are used in the Japanese, but their use in the English is inappropriate. Also, for the purposes of this translation, I think a fairly short explanation of samue should suffice.
sen.e: Many of the railway's employees, including the crew and the ticket agents, wear samue (work clothes worn by Buddhist priests).

sen.j: 路線距離（営業キロ）：207m (0.2km)
sen.e: Railway distance (operation kilometers): 207 meters (0.2 km)
Track length (operating distance): 207 meters (0.2 km)
Track length (operating distance): 207 meters (0.2 km)

sen.j: 軌間：800mm
sen.e: Track gauge: 800 mm
Track gauge: 800 mm
Track gauge: 800 mm

sen.j: 駅数：2駅（起終点駅含む）
sen.e: Number of stations: 2 (including the starting and terminal station)
Number of stations: 2 (including the starting and terminal station)
Number of stations: 2 (including the starting and terminal station)

sen.j: 高低差：96m
sen.e: Height: 96meters
Elevation difference: 96 meters
Elevation difference: 96 meters

sen.j: 閑散期は15分間隔の運行で、山門駅は毎時10・25・40・55分発。
sen.e: During the off season, the funicular operates every 15 minutes, starting from Sanmon Station at 10, 25, 40 and 55 every hour.
During the off season, the funicular runs every 15 minutes, departing from Sanmon Station at 10, 25, 40 and 55 minutes past every hour.
During the off season, the funicular runs every 15 minutes, departing from Sanmon Station at 10, 25, 40 and 55 minutes past every hour.

sen.j: 多宝塔駅はその3分後の発車。
sen.e: And in three minutes, the funicular leaves Tahoto Station for the opposite direction.
It leaves Tahoto Station three minutes later.
It leaves Tahoto Station three minutes later.

sen.j: 所要時間は約2分。
sen.e: It takes about two minutes to cover the one-way distance.
It takes about two minutes to cover the distance.
It takes about two minutes to cover the distance.

sen.j: 始発は山門駅発の場合は8時18分で、最終は多宝塔駅の場合が16時50分で、6月から8月までは17時20分に延長される。
sen.e: The first service starts at 8:18 when departing from Sanmon Station, and the last one leaves at 16:50 when departing from Tahoto Station, and from June to August, the last one is prolonged at 17:20.
The first service leaves Sanmon Station at 8:18, and the last one leaves Tahoto Station at 16:50 or, from June to August, at 17:20.
sen.cmt: Reworded first part of sentence"and"→"or"Deleted "the last one is prolonged"
sen.e: The first service leaves Sanmon Station at 8:18, and the last one leaves Tahoto Station at 16:50 or, from June to August, at 17:20.

sen.j: 多客時はピストン運転されるが、乗車定員が少ないために乗車までにかなり待つ日もある。
sen.e: During the high season, the funicular shuttles between the two stations, but its capacity sometimes forces some passengers to wait considerably long.
During the high season, the funicular shuttles between the two stations, but its capacity sometimes forces some passengers to wait considerably long.
During the high season, the funicular shuttles between the two stations, but its capacity sometimes forces some passengers to wait a considerable time.
sen.cmt: 文法間違い。 - “to wait considerably long.” => “to wait a considerable time.”

sen.j: 車両は1996年製の3代目で幼いころ鞍馬寺で修行した源義経の幼名牛若丸にちなみ「牛若號III」の愛称がついている。
sen.e: The rolling stock was made in 1996, now serves as the third generation, and is nicknamed as 'Ushiwaka-go Ⅲ' after Ushiwakamaru, who was disciplined in Kurama-dera Temple in his childhood and later renamed MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.

The current, third generation rolling stock was manufactured in 1996, and is nicknamed 'Ushiwaka-go Ⅲ' after MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, whose childhood name was Ushiwakamaru and who studied at Kurama-dera Temple.

The current, third generation rolling stock was manufactured in 1996, and is nicknamed 'Ushiwaka-go Ⅲ' after MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, whose childhood name was Ushiwakamaru and who studied at Kurama-dera Temple.

sen.j: 乗客定員：31人（ただし、実際は28人で運用されている）
sen.e: Capacity: 31people (but operated as 28 in reality)
Capacity: 31people (but actually only carries 28)
sen.cmt: "operated as 28 in reality"→"but actually only carries 28"
sen.e: Capacity: 31people (but in fact only carries 28)

sen.j: 軌道及び運行システム設計・施工：安全索道株式会社（1996年）
sen.e: Design & construction of the track & operation system: Anzen Sakudo Co., Ltd. (in 1996)
Design & construction of the track & control system: Anzen Sakudo Co., Ltd. (1996)
Design & construction of the track & control system: Anzen Sakudo Co., Ltd. (1996)

sen.j: 車両製作：大阪車輌工業株式会社（1996年）
sen.e: Rolling stock manufacturing: Osaka Sharyo Kogyo Co., Ltd.
Rolling stock manufacturer: Osaka Sharyo Kogyo Co., Ltd.
Rolling stock manufacturer: Osaka Sharyo Kogyo Co., Ltd. (1996)

sen.j: 軌間800mmのゴムタイヤ式の1両の車両と錘との交走式で、架線が廃止されモノレールや新交通システムのように軌道脇から集電する方式となった（なお、ケーブルカーの走行中の集電は、照明および前照灯、車内放送および前窓ワイパー用であり動力用ではない）。
sen.e: The track gauge is 800 mm, and a single car, linked by cable with the counterbalancing sinker, runs on rubber wheel, and after the removal of the overhead wire, the elecricity becomes channeled from the wire just alongside the railway, which is adopted in the operation of the monorail and the automated guideway transit (but the electricity channeled during the run is needed for the the headlight, the announcement & light within the car and the windshield wiper, not for the motive power).
sen.cmt: 「車両と錘との交走式」とは「ケーブルの一方に車両を、他方に錘をつなぎ、両方を井戸のつるべのようにバランスを取って動かす方式」のことで、それを下線部では表現しているつもりです。
sen.e: A single car, counterbalanced by a weight, runs on rubber wheels on an 800 mm gauge track and, since the removal of the overhead wire, elecricity (which is needed for the the headlights, the announcements, lights within the car and the windshield wipers but not for driving) is provided alongside the track, similar to monorails and new transit systems.

A single car, counterbalanced by a weight, runs on rubber wheels on an 800 mm gauge track and, since the removal of the overhead wire, electricity (which is needed for the headlights, the announcements, lights within the car and the windshield wipers but not for locomotion) is provided alongside the track, similar to monorails and new transit systems.

sen.j: 開業当初の車両は軌間762mmの鉄車輪2両交走式だった。
sen.e: When the railway launched the operation, the track gauge was 762mm, two counterbalancing cars were linked by cable with each other, and those cars ran on the steel wheel.
sen.cmt: 「2両交走式」とは「ケーブルの両端に車両をつなぎ、両方のバランスを取って動かす方式」のことで、それを下線部では表現しているつもりです。
sen.e: When the line first opened, the track gauge was 762mm, with two steel-wheeled cars counterbalancing each other.
sen.cmt: "railway launched the operation"→"line first opened"Reworded and combined last two clauses
sen.e: When the line first opened, the track gauge was 762 mm, with two steel-wheeled cars counterbalancing each other.
sen.cmt: 単位の前にスペース挿入

sen.j: 2代目よりゴムタイヤ式・錘との交走式に改められた。
sen.e: The system of the second generation was modified into one having the rubber wheel and a single car linked by cable with the counterbalancing sinker.
For the second generation, a single rubber-wheeled car counterbalanced by a weight was introduced..
For the second generation, a single rubber-wheeled car counterbalanced by a weight was introduced..

sen.j: 2代目車両の時は架線集電を行っていた。
sen.e: But the second one was still provided with the elecricity from the overhead wire.
But it was still provided with elecricity from an overhead wire.
However it was still provided with electricity from an overhead wire.

sen.j: 鉄道事業法による許可を受けた鉄道としては、現在唯一の運賃が無料の鉄道である（かつては箕面鋼索鉄道も無料であった）。
sen.e: Among all railways permitted by Railway Business Act, this is the only one that is free of fare (in the past, Mino'o Funicular Railway was also free).

Of all the railways that have been granted permission to operate under the Railway Business Act, this is the only one that is free of charge (though in the past, Mino'o Funicular Railway was also free).

Of all the railways that have been granted permission to operate under the Railway Business Act, this is the only one that is free of charge (though in the past, Minoo Funicular Railway was also free).

sen.j: ただし、諸堂維持の寄付金を1口100円寄付した人だけが無料で乗車できるようになっているので、寄付金100円が事実上の運賃と言える。
sen.e: But people can get free ride only when they donate at least \100 as the maintenance costs of the temple and the shrine on Mount Kurama, so the donation can be said the fare in substance.
However, the fare is only free when people donate at least \100 to the maintenance costs of the temple and the shrine on Mount Kurama, so the donation can be said to be the fare.
sen.cmt: "But"→"However,"Reworded first part of sentenceAdded "to be"Deleted "in substance"
sen.e: However, the fare is only free when people donate at least \100 to the maintenance costs of the temple and the shrine on Mount Kurama, so the donation can be said to be the fare.

sen.j: 「運賃」扱いだと宗教法人といえども課税されるが、「寄付金」だと非課税扱いになるためである。
sen.e: This method is taken because 'fare' becomes the target of taxation even when earned by a religious corporation while 'donation' does not.
This method is taken because a 'fare' is taxed, even when earned by a religious institution, while a 'donation' is not.
sen.cmt: Added "a""becomes the target of taxation"→"is taxed""corporation"→"institution"
sen.e: This method is used because a 'fare' is taxed, even when earned by a religious institution, while a 'donation' is not.

sen.j: 事実上の運賃である寄付金額がわずか100円であることや、鞍馬寺の拝観料に相当する「愛山料」が200円（中学生以下は無料）であることを考えると、非常に良心的な「運賃設定」と言える。
sen.e: A donation, constituting a de facto fare, is set at just \100, and an 'aizanryo,' constituting an admission fee of Kurama-dera Temple, is set at \200 (free for junior high school students and under), so they can be said quite reasonable.
The donation-cum-fare of just \100, and the \200 'aizanryo' admission fee of Kurama-dera Temple (free for junior high school students and under) can be said to be quite reasonable.
sen.cmt: "constituting a de facto"→"-cum-"", is set at""→"of"Changed word order
sen.e: The donation-cum-fare of just \100, and the \200 'aizanryo' admission fee of Kurama-dera Temple (free for junior high school students and under) can be said to be quite reasonable.

sen.j: 事実上の乗車券である「参拝記念の花びら（片道乗車票）」は、駅受付（事実上の切符売場）で諸堂維持の寄付をした人に1口1枚交付される。
sen.e: The de facto one-way ticket of the railway, or a 'petal-shaped memorial,' is handed for a donation of \100 at the reception (the de facto window of the railway ticket).
A one-way ticket, or a 'petal-shaped memorial,' is received for a donation of \100 at the reception (which is also the ticket office).
sen.cmt: "The"→"a"Deleted "de facto" and "of the railway""handed"→"received"Changed part in brackets.
sen.e: A one-way ticket, which is in fact a 'petal-shaped memorial,' is received for a donation of \100 at the reception (which is in effect the ticket office).
sen.cmt: "which is also the ticket office)."の 「事実上の」の意味が不明瞭のため書き換えました。"actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: 花びらには「鞍馬山内の諸堂や施設を維持するためにご協力いただきありがとうございました。
sen.e: "Thank you for your cooperation in sharing in the maintenance costs of the temple, shrine and other facilities on Mt. Kurama.
"Thank you for your cooperation in sharing in the maintenance costs of the temple, shrine and other facilities on Mt. Kurama.
Thank you for your cooperation in sharing in the maintenance costs of the temple, shrine and other facilities on Mt. Kurama.

sen.j: そのお礼としてケーブルカーを片道ご利用いただきます。
sen.e: In return, we'd like to offer you a one-way ticket of the funicular railway.
In return, we'd like to offer you this one-way ticket.
In return, we'd like to offer you this one-way ticket.

sen.j: この花びらを係員に提示してご乗車ください。
sen.e: Please show this petal-shaped ticket to the receptionist and get on the car,"
Please show this petal-shaped ticket to the receptionist and board the car,"
Please show this petal-shaped ticket to the receptionist and board the car,'

sen.j: 」と記され、ハスの花びらの形をした紙の下には、半券を切り離すことができるミシン目がある。
sen.e: says the ticket that is shaped like a petal of a lotus flower, and it has in its lower part the perforations to separate the stub.
says the ticket that is shaped like a petal of a lotus flower, with perforations in the lower part to separate the stub.
says the ticket that is shaped like a petal of a lotus flower, with perforations in the lower part to separate the stub.

sen.j: なお寺側は、歩くことが可能な人はケーブルカーを使用せずに参道を歩くことを勧めている。
sen.e: But the temple recommends visitors, if they can, to walk the approach instead of getting on the funicular railway.
However, the temple recommends visitors, if they can, to walk the approach instead of getting on the funicular railway.
However, the temple recommends visitors, if they can, to walk the approach instead of getting on the funicular railway.

sen.j: 自然の中を歩いて参拝してこそ、鞍馬寺の本尊であり、自然の力の根源である「尊天」をより強く感じることができるからだという理由からである。
sen.e: Because they can feel 'Sonten' much stronger, which is worshiped as the central Buddhist image of Kurama-dera Temple and as the source of Nature, exactly when they walk through the nature, it says.
The reason being that, by waling in nature, they will be able to feel more strongly the 'Sonten,' the source of nature's power, which is worshiped as the main Buddhist image of Kurama-dera Temple.
The reason being that, by walking in nature, they will be able to feel more strongly the 'Sonten,' the source of nature's power, which is worshiped as the main Buddhist image of Kurama-dera Temple.

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年）1月1日 山門～多宝塔間が開業。
sen.e: On January 1, 1957, the funicular railway began its operation between Sanmon Station and Tahoto Station.
On January 1, 1957, the funicular railway began operating between Sanmon Station and Tahoto Station.
January 1, 1957: The funicular railway began operating between Sanmon Station and Tahoto Station.

sen.j: 1975年（昭和50年） 2代目車両運行開始。
sen.e: In 1975, the second generation rolling stock began its operation.
In 1975, the second generation rolling stock came into service.
1975: The second generation rolling stock came into service.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）8月8日 3代目車両運行開始。
sen.e: On August 8, 1996, the third generation rolling stock began its operation.
On August 8, 1996, the third generation rolling stock was introduced.
August 8, 1996: The third generation of rolling stock was introduced.
sen.cmt: ”of”の脱落。 - “the third generation rolling”=>”the third generation of rolling”

sen.j: ゴムタイヤ式。
sen.e: It runs on rubber wheel.
It runs on rubber wheels.
It runs on rubber wheels.

sen.j: 山門駅
sen.e: Sanmon Station
Sanmon Station
Sanmon Station

sen.j: 「普明殿」という1992年完成の堂が、駅舎を兼ねている。
sen.e: A Buddhist structure, completed in 1992 and called 'Fumyoden,' serves as the station building.
A Buddhist structure, completed in 1992 and called 'Fumyoden,' serves as the station.
A Buddhist structure, completed in 1992 and called 'Fumyoden,' serves as the station.

sen.j: 多宝塔駅
sen.e: Tahoto Station
Tahoto Station
Tahoto Station

sen.j: ケーブルカー開通当時に建てられた「多宝塔礼堂」という堂が駅舎を兼ねている。
sen.e: A Buddhist structure called 'Tahoto-Reido' was built when the funicular railroad launched the operation, and it serves as the railroad building.
A Buddhist structure called 'Tahoto-Reido,' that was built when the funicular railroad started operating, serves as the station.
A Buddhist structure called 'Tahoto-Reido,' that was built when the funicular railroad started operating, serves as the station.

sen.j: 山門駅：叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鞍馬駅から徒歩5分。
sen.e: Sanmon Station: It takes 5 minutes to get there on foot from Kurama Station of Kurama Line, operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd.
Sanmon Station is about 5 minutes on foot from Kurama Station on the Kurama Line, operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd.
sen.cmt: Deleted colon and "to get there""It takes"→"is about""of"→"on"
sen.e: Sanmon Station is about 5 minutes on foot from Kurama Station on the Kurama Line, operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
